title: Evolution and molecular characteristics of SARS-CoV-2 genome
author: Yunmeng Bai,#, Dawei Jiang,#, Jerome R Lon,#, Xiaoshi Chen, Meiling Hu, Shudai
affiliations: School of Biology and Biological Engineering, South China University of Technology
State Clinic Center of Gearitic, Chinese PLA General Hospital, Beijing 100853
KingMed Transformative Medicine Institute Co., Ltd, Guangzhou
abstract:
In the evolution analysis of 622 or 3624 complete SARS-CoV-2 genomes, the estimated Ka/Ks ratio is 1.008 or 1.094, which is higher than that of SARS-CoV and
MERS-CoV, and the time to the most recent common ancestor (tMRCA) is inferred in late September 2019, indicating that SARS-CoV-2 may have completed positive selection pressure of the cross-host evolution in the early stage. Further we find 9 key specific sites of highly linkage which play a decisive role in the classification of
SARS-CoV-2. Notably the frequencies of haplotype TTTG and H1 are generally high in European countries and correlated to death rate (r>0.37) based on 3624 or 16373

award-group.funding-source: National Key R&D Program of China
Science and the Technology Planning Project of Guangzhou
